radiographic_examinations.findings: The appendix is fluid-filled and dilated measuring 1.1 cm, with wall thickening and associated stranding of the surrounding mesentery, compatible with appendicitis. No evidence of free fluid or perforation. Visualized lung fields are within normal limits. No pleural or pericardial effusion. The liver, pancreas, spleen, adrenal glands, kidneys, stomach, small bowel, colon, rectum, urinary bladder, uterus, and bilateral adnexae appear normal. No significant vascular or bone abnormalities noted.
